column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4441_ffebc1be43751050c0b35d7140ba127783708d13/ for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-te
This script surprises me. It downloads the files, verifies them, then deletes them all again. And it doesn't appear to have an option to keep them around.\n
Yes, it does seem to do the bare minimum\n

But I don't see the point. Say, you run verify.sh and it succeeds. It only proves that the executables downloaded by the script (and subsequently thrown away) are valid. If you use the positive output of verify.sh to download the executables again, you may get binaries that are tampered with.\n\nAnyhow, not an important issue. Maybe this script is only used by Gavin to check whether he uploaded th
